{{coord|-36.8481|174.7639|display=title}} '''Media Design School''' is a private [[tertiary institution]] that provides specialist industry training in 3D animation and visual effects,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mediadesignschool.com/courses/3d-animation-visual-effects/ |title=3D Animation & VFX | Media Design School New Zealand | Media Design School New Zealand |publisher=Mediadesignschool.com |date=2016-08-27 |accessdate=2016-08-27}}</ref> game art,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mediadesignschool.com/courses/game-art |title=Bachelor of Creative Technologies (Game Art) | Media Design School New Zealand |publisher=Mediadesignschool.com |date= |accessdate=2016-08-27}}</ref> game programming,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mediadesignschool.com/courses/game-programming |title=Bachelor of Software Engineering (Game Development) | Media Design School New Zealand |publisher=Mediadesignschool.com |date= |accessdate=2016-08-27}}</ref> graphic and motion design,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mediadesignschool.com/courses/graphic-design |title=Bachelor of Media Design | Media Design School New Zealand |publisher=Mediadesignschool.com |date= |accessdate=2016-08-27}}</ref> [[digital media]] and creative advertising.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mediadesignschool.com/courses/creative-advertising/ |title=Creative Advertising | Media Design School New Zealand | Media Design School New Zealand |publisher=Mediadesignschool.com |date= |accessdate=2013-11-05}}</ref> It is currently the most awarded private tertiary provider in New Zealand for digital and creative technology qualifications.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.screenz.co.nz/mds-ranked-worlds-4th-best-vfxanimation-school/ |title=MDS ranked world’s 4th best VFX/Animation school |publisher=screenz.co.nz |date= |accessdate=2016-08-27}}</ref> In 2015, the school was also ranked the fourth best provider globally for [[visual effects]] and [[animation]] training by the [[Autodesk]] CG Student Awards.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.laureate.net/OurNetwork/AsiaPacific/NewZealand/MediaDesignSchool/Content/Public/AnnouncementContentFolder/2015/07/Media-Design-School-Ranked-4th-Best-Global-VFXAnimation-School |title=Media Design School Ranked 4th Best Global VFX/Animation School |publisher=laureate.net |date= |accessdate=2016-08-27}}</ref> It is located in central [[Auckland]], [[New Zealand]] and was established in 1998. The school is part of [[Laureate International Universities]], the world’s largest private university group with over 70 universities in 29 countries and online, including dedicated design schools in [[San Diego, California]], and Santa Fe, New Mexico, USA; and Milan, Italy.
Media Design School's qualifications are approved by [[New Zealand Qualifications Authority]] (NZQA). It offers courses from Level 6 and 7 diplomas through to Level 8 and 9 postgraduate certificates and a Masters programme.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mediadesignschool.com/courses |title=Current Courses | Media Design School New Zealand | Media Design School New Zealand |publisher=Mediadesignschool.com |date= |accessdate=2016-08-27}}</ref>
==Game Development== Media Design School is the only tertiary institute in New Zealand where students can develop for [[Playstation]] platforms with console [[Software development kit|development kits]], due to an exclusive partnership with [[Sony Computer Entertainment Europe]].<ref>[http://www.mediadesign.school.nz/developmentkits ] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080420190120/http://www.mediadesign.school.nz/developmentkits |date=April 20, 2008 }}</ref> Graduates have gone on to work at a variety of game development studios,<ref>{{cite web|author= |url=http://www.mediadesignschool.com/about/success-stories |title=Alumni | Media Design School New Zealand |publisher=Mediadesignschool.com |date=2016-08-27 |accessdate=2016-08-27}}</ref> such as [[PikPok]], [[Bohemia Interactive]], [[Grinding Gear Games]], [[Gameloft]], [[EA Digital Illusions CE]], [[RocketWerkz]] and [[CerebralFix]]. [[Ninja Kiwi]], who developed the popular [[Bloons TD|Bloons Tower Defense]] game, was also founded by a graduate of the game development course.
The joint game development department also runs an annual national initiative called Girls in Games, focused on providing experience in programming and game art for high-school aged female students based in the North Island.<ref>{{cite web|author= |url=http://www.mediadesignschool.com/blog/girls-in-games-2016 |title=Girls in Games 2016 | Media Design School New Zealand |publisher=Mediadesignschool.com |date=2016-08-27 |accessdate=2016-08-27}}</ref>
In 2015, Media Design School Studios was established as the first games focused accelerator programme in a New Zealand tertiary institution.<ref>{{cite web|author= |url=http://www.mediadesignschool.com/about/mdsstudios |title=Media Design School Studios | Media Design School New Zealand |publisher=Mediadesignschool.com |date=2016-08-27 |accessdate=2016-08-27}}</ref> This programme has resulted in commercial releases such as Split ([[Itsfine Games]]),<ref>{{cite web|author= |url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/444860/ |title=Split on Steam |publisher=store.steampowered.com |date=2016-08-27 |accessdate=2016-08-27}}</ref> Dolly ([[MA Studios]])<ref>{{cite web|author= |url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=538868474 |title=Dolly on Steam Greenlight |publisher=steamcommunity.com |date=2016-08-27 |accessdate=2016-08-27}}</ref> and Tons of Guns ([[Voidworks]])<ref>{{cite web|author= |url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=538938737 |title=Tons of Guns on Steam Greenlight |publisher=steamcommunity.com |date=2016-08-27 |accessdate=2016-08-27}}</ref> on [[Valve Corporation|Valve]]'s Steam platform.
==Animation and visual effects== Student short films and productions have received major international accolades, with titles such as Accidents, Blunders and Calamities being awarded Best Animated Film at [[San Diego Comic-Con]]'s independent film festival in 2016.<ref>{{cite web|author= |url=http://www.stuff.co.nz/entertainment/film/82610275/Kiwi-film-Accidents-Blunders-and-Calamities-wins-award-at-Comi-Con |title=iwi film Accidents, Blunders and Calamities wins award at Comi-Con |publisher=stuff.co.nz |date=2016-08-27 |accessdate=2016-08-27}}</ref>
Graduates from the program have been employed by [[Weta Digital]] to work on blockbuster projects such as [[Avatar (2009 film)|Avatar]] and [[The Lord of the Rings (film series)|The Lord of the Rings]],<ref>{{cite web|author= |url=http://www.mediadesignschool.com/courses/3d-animation-visual-effects |title=Bachelor of Art and Design | Media Design School New Zealand |publisher=mediadesignschool.com |date=2016-08-27 |accessdate=2016-08-27}}</ref> and other animation studios such as [[Pukeko Pictures]] and [[Oktober Animation|Oktober]].
Notable productions include: * ''Accidents, Blunders and Calamities'' (2015)<ref>{{cite web|author= |url=https://vimeo.com/172490277 |title=Accidents, Blunders and Calamities | Vimeo |publisher=vimeo.com |date=2016-08-27 |accessdate=2016-08-27}}</ref> - [[San Diego Comic-Con]] International Independent Film Festival Best Animated Film 2016, Show Me Shorts People's Choice & Best Editor 2015<ref>{{cite web|author= |url=http://www.showmeshorts.co.nz/the-awards/previous-winners/ |title=Previous Winners | ShowMeShorts |publisher=showmeshorts.co.nz |date=2016-08-27 |accessdate=2016-08-27}}</ref> * ''Escargore'' (2015)<ref>{{cite web|author= |url=https://vimeo.com/143703730 |title=Escargore | Vimeo |publisher=vimeo.com |date=2016-08-27 |accessdate=2016-08-27}}</ref> - [[SIGGRAPH]] Asia Official Selection 2015, Idaho Horror Film Festival Best Animated Film 2015, [[Columbus International Film & Video Festival]] Official Selection 2015, Animago Awards Best Character 2015<ref>{{cite web|author= |url=http://www.scoop.co.nz/stories/CU1510/S00382/escargore-a-snail-horror-comedy.htm |title=Escargore: A snail horror comedy |publisher=scoop.co.nz |date=2016-08-27 |accessdate=2016-08-27}}</ref> * ''Shelved'' (2012)<ref>{{cite web|author= |url=https://vimeo.com/45684858 |title=Shelved on Vimeo |publisher=Vimeo.com |date=2012-07-13 |accessdate=2013-11-05}}</ref> * ''Funeral Home Pinatas'' (2012)<ref>{{cite web|author= |url=https://vimeo.com/45806376 |title=Funeral Home Piñatas on Vimeo |publisher=Vimeo.com |date=2012-07-15 |accessdate=2013-11-05}}</ref> * ''Dr Grordbort Presents: The Deadliest Game'' (2011) * ''Rotting Hill'' (2011)<ref>{{cite web|author= |url=https://vimeo.com/25010746 |title=Rotting Hill on Vimeo |publisher=Vimeo.com |date=2011-06-12 |accessdate=2013-11-05}}</ref> starring [[Anna Hutchison]] * ''Das Tub'' (2011)<ref>{{cite web|author= |url=https://vimeo.com/13497499 |title=Das Tub on Vimeo |publisher=Vimeo.com |date=2010-07-20 |accessdate=2013-11-05}}</ref> * ''First Contact'' (2010)<ref>{{cite web|url=https://vimeo.com/17272913 |title=First Contact on Vimeo |publisher=Vimeo.com |date=2010-11-28 |accessdate=2013-11-05}}</ref> * ''Time for Change'' (2010)<ref>{{cite web|author= |url=https://vimeo.com/12191214 |title=Time For Change on Vimeo |publisher=Vimeo.com |date=2010-05-31 |accessdate=2013-11-05}}</ref>
==Other departments== The AdSchool at Media Design School was named fourth best creative school of the decade by [[YoungGuns Awards]], which recognises the world's hottest creative talent under the age of thirty.<ref>{{cite web|author= |url=http://www.mediadesignschool.com/blog/entry/media-design-school-named-in-the-top-5-creative-schools-in-the-world/ |title=Media Design School named in the Top 5 Creative Schools in the World | Media Design School New Zealand |publisher=Mediadesignschool.com |date=2010-09-10 |accessdate=2012-02-10}}</ref>
==Student games== Graduate Diploma of Game Development: * Discord<ref name="mediadesignschool3">{{cite web|url=http://www.mediadesignschool.com/game-testing/ |title=Play Our Games | Media Design School New Zealand |publisher=Mediadesignschool.com |date= |accessdate=2013-11-05}}</ref> * Sklum Lord<ref name="mediadesignschool3"/> * Dead Steel<ref name="mediadesignschool3"/> - IGF China 2010, Excellent Student Award,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.gdcchina.com/events/igf_finalists.html |title=Game Developers Conference China | November 12-14, 2011 | Shanghai Exhibition Center | Shanghai, China |publisher=Gdcchina.com |date=2011-11-12 |accessdate=2012-02-10}}</ref> IGF 2011 Student Competition Entrant,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.igf.com/php-bin/entry2011.php?id=138 |title=The 14th Annual Independent Games Festival - Dead_Steel |publisher=Igf.com |date= |accessdate=2012-02-10}}</ref> * No More Gentlemen <ref name="mediadesignschool1">{{cite web|url=http://www.mediadesignschool.com/game-testing/ |title=Play Our Games | Media Design School New Zealand |publisher=Mediadesignschool.com |date= |accessdate=2012-02-10}}</ref> - IGF 2011 Student Competition Entrant <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.igf.com/php-bin/entry2011.php?id=136 |title=The 14th Annual Independent Games Festival - No_More_Gentlemen |publisher=Igf.com |date= |accessdate=2012-02-10}}</ref> * Guardians of Eldvery <ref name="mediadesignschool1"/> - IGF 2011 Student Competition Entrant <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.igf.com/php-bin/entry2011.php?id=137 |title=The 14th Annual Independent Games Festival - Guardians_of_Eldvery |publisher=Igf.com |date= |accessdate=2012-02-10}}</ref> * Nightfall<ref>{{cite web|url=http://gdfeb08.blogspot.com/ |title=Nightfall - Production Blog |publisher=Gdfeb08.blogspot.com |date= |accessdate=2013-11-05}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|author=Resumes by Name |url=http://www.thebigidea.co.nz/grow/tips-tools/2009/jul/58001-media-design-students-launch-nightfall-game |title=Media Design students launch Nightfall game | The Big Idea | Te Aria Nui |publisher=The Big Idea |date=2009-07-03 |accessdate=2012-02-10}}</ref> * Roadblock<ref>[http://www.mediadesign.school.nz/static/roadblock/ ] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080621061843/http://www.mediadesign.school.nz/static/roadblock/ |date=June 21, 2008 }}</ref> * Affliction - IGF Student Showcase, 2008 <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.igf.com/php-bin/entry2008.php?id=275 |title=The 14th Annual Independent Games Festival |publisher=Igf.com |date= |accessdate=2012-02-10}}</ref> * Shear Factor - [[Crowbar Awards]] 2007, Bronze Medal Winner <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.4as.org.sg/pdf/crowbarwinners2006.pdf |title=The Crowbar Awards 2006 : Advertising |publisher=4as.org.sg |accessdate=2013-11-05}}</ref> * Goliath<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.goliathgame.com/ |title=Goliath - What The Apocalypse Didn't Kill, Goliath Will |publisher=Goliathgame.com |date= |accessdate=2013-11-05}}</ref> - [[Crowbar Awards]] 2006 Silver Medal Winner, IGF Student Showcase Winner 2006 <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.igf.com/php-bin/entries2006_students.php?entry_id=196 |title=The 16th Annual Independent Games Festival |publisher=Igf.com |date= |accessdate=2013-11-05}}</ref>
Diploma of Interactive Gaming: * Cygni * Total Cube Domination * Interstellar Excavation * The Uprising<ref>{{cite web|author= |url=http://www.mediadesignschool.com/blog/entry/game-programming-students-to-present-the-uprising/ |title=Game programming students to present The Uprising | Media Design School New Zealand |publisher=Mediadesignschool.com |date=2010-02-10 |accessdate=2013-11-05}}</ref> * Harvest<ref name="mediadesignschool2">{{cite web|author= |url=http://www.mediadesignschool.com/blog/entry/game-coders-are-blogging/ |title=Game coders are blogging | Media Design School New Zealand |publisher=Mediadesignschool.com |date=2009-10-20 |accessdate=2013-11-05}}</ref> * Battleballs<ref name="mediadesignschool2"/> * Loop Troops<ref>{{cite web|url=http://igapr08.blogspot.com/ |title=IGAPR08 |publisher=Igapr08.blogspot.com |date= |accessdate=2013-11-05}}</ref> - Bronze Medal Winner, Crowbar Awards, 2009<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.4as.org.sg/pdf/09%20Crowbar%20Awards%20Results.pdf |title=The Crowbar Awards 2009 : Best of Show |publisher=4as.org.sg |accessdate=2013-11-05}}</ref> * Oddballs - Silver Medal Winner, Crowbar Awards, 2008 <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.gamecareerguide.com/downloads/games/130 |title=Oddballs |publisher=GameCareerGuide.com |date=2008-04-23 |accessdate=2012-02-10}}</ref> * Happy Traps - IGF Student Showcase, 2008.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.igf.com/php-bin/entry2008.php?id=268 |title=The 14th Annual Independent Games Festival |publisher=Igf.com |date= |accessdate=2012-02-10}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.gamecareerguide.com/features/466/student_postmortem_happy_.php?page=1 |title=Student Postmortem: Happy Traps |publisher=GameCareerGuide.com |date= |accessdate=2012-02-10}}</ref> * Rash

revision.text:
{{Infobox soap character | series = Neighbours | name = Mishti Sharma | image = [[File:Mishti Sharma.jpg|200px]] | portrayer = Scarlet Vas | introducer = [[Jason Herbison]] | first = {{Start date|2017|04|18|df=y}} | last = {{End date|2018|10|19|df=y}} | years = 2017–2018 |classification = [[List of past Neighbours characters#S|Former; regular]] | occupation = {{plainlist| *Waitress *Gym co-owner *Police officer }} | home = [[Sydney ]] | sisters = [[Dipi Rebecchi]] | nieces = [[Yashvi Rebecchi]]
[[Kirsha Rebecchi]] | nephews = Jay Rebecchi }} '''Mishti Sharma''' is a fictional character from the Australian soap opera ''[[Neighbours]]'', played by Scarlet Vas. She made her first appearance during the episode broadcast on 18 April 2017. The character was introduced alongside an extended branch of the show's long-standing Rebecchi family, who consist of Indian-Australians. The show's producer [[Jason Herbison]] thought their inclusion was important to better reflect Australian society. Actress Sharon Johal who plays Mishti's sister [[Dipi Rebecchi]] originally auditioned for the role of Mishti. When writers changed the characters age they hired Vas to play her instead. Vas made her final appearance as Mishti on 19 October 2018. Mishti is characterised as having a strong passion for physical fitness and is family oriented. She often plays the role of peacemaker in her family when they argue. Vas has described Mishti as a "harsh" character who is "righteous about staying within the law." When Mishti arrives in [[Erinsborough]] she is keen to start a new life, suggesting she has a troubled past. She forms a business partnership with [[Aaron Brennan]] (Matt Wilson) and opens a gym called The Shed. But viewers soon learn that Mishti is an ex-police officer who left the force following the death of her boyfriend Zander. Mishti's storylines have mainly focused on her relationship with [[Leo Tanaka]] (Tim Kano) and their many dramas. She also features in a pregnancy and miscarriage story. The character returns to the police force and begins investigating her neighbours who she believes are embroiled in the murder of [[Hamish Roche]] (Sean Taylor). Reaction to Mishti has been positive and Claire Crick from ''[[Soaplife]]'' branded her and Leo a "power couple". ==Casting== The character and casting details were announced on 27 March. Mishti is [[Dipi Rebecchi]]'s (Sharon Johal) sister. She arrives in [[Erinsborough]] with Dipi's husband [[Shane Rebecchi]] (Nicholas Coghlan), an extended branch of the show's long-standing Rebecchi family. The new Rebecchis are an Indian-Australian family. The show's producer [[Jason Herbison]] stated that "we felt it was important that our new extended Rebecchi family reflect the cultural diversity of the community and our audience." Network Ten's Head of Drama, Rick Maier added that "the new Rebecchi clan make for a very welcome addition to the neighbourhood, bringing fun, warmth and intrigue."{{cite web|last1=Knox|first1=David|title=Neighbours casting for diversity|url=https://tvtonight.com.au/2017/03/neighbours-casting-for-diversity.html|website=[[TV Tonight]]|accessdate=28 March 2018|date=28 March 2017}} Vas was given the part a couple of days after she graduated from university, which she stated "was a dream come true". Vas found her first day on-set "nerve-wracking" but quickly settled into the role. Johal initially auditioned for the role after she received a call from the casting team.{{cite web|last1=Grewal|first1=Preetinder|title=Punjabi actress Sharon Johal hits Australia's small screen on Neighbours|url=https://www.sbs.com.au/yourlanguage/punjabi/en/article/2017/05/17/punjabi-actress-sharon-johal-hits-australias-small-screen-neighbours|website=[[Sbs.com.au]]|accessdate=28 March 2018|date=17 May 2017}} Mishti was originally supposed to be older, but casting directors decided to look for a younger actress following changes to the character's age. Producers still liked Johal's work and cast her as the much older Dipi instead.{{cite journal|title=Sharon Johal Neighbours' Dipi Rebecchi ...faces your questions!|journal=[[Inside Soap]]|date=7-13 October 2017|issue=40|pages=46–47|publisher=([[Hearst Magazines UK]])}} Mishti made her first appearance on 18 April 2017.{{cite journal|date=15–21 April 2017|title=Soap diary|journal=[[TV Week]]|publisher=([[Bauer Media Group]])|issue=15|quote=A traveller called Mishti is a welcome distraction for Leo.}} ==Development== ===Characterisation=== {{Quote box|width=20%|align=right|bgcolor=#E6E6FA|quote="Mishti is Dipi Rebecchi’s sister. She has passion for physical fitness. She grew up in Sydney, but has just arrived in Erinsborough, keen for a fresh start. While she seems enthusiastic about what this new place has to offer, there is an air of sadness about her. What dark secret is she carrying – and why is she really here?"{{cite web|title=Mishti Sharma|url=https://tenplay.com.au/channel-eleven/neighbours/characters/mishti-sharma|website=[[Tenplay]]|accessdate=28 March 2018}}|source=—An excerpt taken from Mishti's character biography hosted by [[Tenplay]].}}The show's official website have stated that Mishti is keen on physical fitness training and enthusiastic about starting a new life in Erinsborough. But she often appears sad because of her past experiences which are initially kept secret from viewers. Mishti is very family oriented and close to her sister Dipi. She has a history of being in the police force and therefore is keen to uphold the law. Vas has described Mishti as a "harsh" character who is "righteous about staying within the law." She is also "kind, warm-hearted and sweet" despite her career. Vas also believes Mishti "certainly knows what she wants and how to get it." Vas has said that Mishti's "smarts are like her super powers, she's very savvy." She uses this in her approach to solving crimes. She behaves in a very moral and righteous manner. Vas said that when another character tries to bribe Mishti, it is a mistake because she is "Mrs Morals". In her approach to police work Mishti has proven to be a nosey neighbour. She wants to solve all the crimes in the show. Vas said viewers has obviously picked up on this trait as Mishti has to know everything in an investigation.{{cite web|title= Neighbourshood - 15th January 2018 - Scarlet Vas (Mishti)|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=e-rl6WdrEDQ|website=[[YouTube]]|accessdate=28 March 2018|date=15 January 2018}} ===Introduction=== Mishti arrives in Erinsborough to see her brother-in-law Shane. Coghlan, who plays Shane has explained that Mishti helps him when he considers moving to the area. The actor also described Mishti as "a dear friend" to Shane and said the two characters "share some pretty serious confidences."{{cite journal|last=Ellis|first=Sarah|date=15–21 April 2017|title=Meet Toadie's big brother!|journal=[[Inside Soap]]|issue=15|page=27}} Mishti comes to Erinsborough wanting a fresh start. However, Daniel Kilkelly of [[Digital Spy]] thought she had a dark secret, noting "there's also an air of sadness about her."{{cite web|url=http://www.digitalspy.com/soaps/neighbours/news/a824471/neighbours-shane-rebecchi-returns-new-family/|title=Neighbours unveils a brand new family as Toadie Rebecchi's brother Shane returns|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|date=27 March 2017|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=([[Hearst Magazines UK]])|accessdate=27 March 2017}} One of Mishti's early roles in her family's story was trying to unite the bickering clan. A series of arguments had left the family angry at one another.{{cite web|last1=Turner|first1=Justin|title=Mishti Sharma takes drastic action to unite her family in Neighbours|url=http://www.whatsontv.co.uk/neighbours/neighbours-pictures/mishti-sharma-drastic-action-unite-family-484250/|website=[[What's on TV]]|publisher=([[Time Inc. UK]])|accessdate=28 March 2018|date=5 August 2017}} Mishti realises she needs to solve the family feud following Dipi's refusal to celebrate their annual Hindi ritual Rakhi. Mishti takes drastic action by handcuffing everyone together and forcing them to speak.{{cite web|title=Can Mishti reunite her family?|url=http://www.whatsontv.co.uk/events/mishti-reunite-family-neighbours/|website=[[What's on TV]]|publisher=([[Time Inc. UK]])|accessdate=28 March 2018|date=7 August 2017}} Mishti then decides to set-up a business in Erinsborough. She asks fellow fitness enthusiast [[Aaron Brennan]] (Matt Wilson) to be her business partner in running a gym. He is hesitant but Mishti goes ahead and buys The Shed. Aaron later agrees to Mishti's plan and they open for business.{{cite web|last1=Turner|first1=Justin|title=Aaron and Mishti strike a deal!|url=http://www.whatsontv.co.uk/neighbours/neighbours-pictures/neighbours-mishti-aaron-business-479707/|website=[[What's on TV]]|publisher=([[Time Inc. UK]])|accessdate=28 March 2018|date=8 July 2017}} Vas told a reporter from ''[[Inside Soap]]'' that Mishti "freaks out" when Aaron first changes his mind. She has to figure out what she can get out of the partnership. The pair eventually bond and become good friends whilst training together. Vas explained that Mishti is "obsessed with fitness" and Aaron's equal passion for it brings them together. Vas was happy with the on-screen friendship because it is "cute".{{cite journal|title=Mishti means business!|journal=[[Inside Soap]]|date=8-14 July 2017|issue=27|pages=34|publisher=([[Hearst Magazines UK]])}} Wilson was also happy with the pairing because it offered his character stability.{{cite web|title=Heart exclusive: Neighbours Heartthrob Matt Wilson Gives Us The Goss On #Daaron's Tragic Love Life|url=http://www.heart.co.uk/showbiz/tv-movies/daytime-tv/heart-exclusive-neighbours-heartthrob-matt-wilson/|website=[[Heart (radio network)|Heart]]|accessdate=28 March 2018|date=28 June 2017}} In another storyline Mishti returns to working as a police officer. When Shane gets drunk and starts threatening [[Gary Canning]] ([[Damien Richardson (actor)|Damien Richardson]]) and vandalising his garden, she is forced to arrest him. Vas told an ''Inside Soap'' reporter that "if Mishti didn't do her job properly it would be very obvious to her superiors." Dipi is angry with Mishti who believes she should have protected her family. But Vas explained that Mishti's role in the Erinsborough is to protect the public and Shane was being drunk and disorderly in public. The actress added that it is a moment when "she is a cop, not a sister."{{cite journal|title=Mishti arrests Shane!|journal=[[Inside Soap]]|date=13-19 January 2018|issue=1|pages=24|publisher=([[Hearst Magazines UK]])}} In Mishti's early month's on-screen it became clear that she was hiding a secret. Mishti does begin to reveal certain aspects of her past to [[Leo Tanaka]] (Tim Kano). Vas told Alison James from ''[[Soaplife]]'' that she begins to confide in him after he earns her trust. Later Mishti and Shane discuss her secret in private which gives the impression they are having an affair. Vas explained that "whatever Mishti’s secret is, it’s complicated and it has the potential to cause problems within the family." She added that Mishti definitely wants Shane to keep her secret from other characters in the show. In addition ''Neighbours'' wanted to keep viewers guessing at what her secret could be.{{cite journal|last1=James|first1=Alison|title=Mishti mystery revealed?|journal=[[Soaplife]]|date=20 May - 2 June 2017|issue=407|pages=40|publisher=([[Time Inc. UK]])}} Mishti and Leo later argue when she discovers that he has been sabotaging his half-sister [[Amy Williams (Neighbours)|Amy Williams']] ([[Zoe Cramond]]) relationship with [[Nick Petrides]] ([[Damien Fotiou]]). Their row esculates when Mishti is distracted and backs her car into [[Tyler Brennan]] ([[Travis Burns (actor)|Travis Burns]]) and runs him over. The scenes were written into the episode to bring back "painful memories" for Mishti involving a past car accident. ===Relationship with Leo Tanaka=== {{cquote|Leo and Mishti equals Flirtation Nation from the very first day they met. [...] While their friendship has developed, so has the length of the longing looks they give one another, as soon as one of them turns the other way. The chemistry between them is explosive, even when they’re fighting. And while we’ve only seen Mishti crack under pressure once, it didn’t go unnoticed by Leo, who often reveals a softer, more caring side when around the tough former police officer.|4=''A reporter from the official ''Neighbours'' website assesses the early stages of their relationship.''{{cite web|title=Cupid Aims Arrow At Erinsborough Residents|url=https://tenplay.com.au/blog/tenplay-trending/cupid-aims-arrow-at-erinsborough-residents|website=[[Tenplay]]|date=21 August 2017|accessdate=28 March 2018}}}}Since her inception Mishti shared many of her scenes with Leo, from which producers began developing a romantic relationship. Initially their bond takes a while to form. After befriending each other Mishti's reluctance to discuss her past causes problems. Vas told James from ''Soaplife'' that "Mishti starts dropping her guard and she begins to confide in him." Leo, a character who had previously been portrayed as ruthless, began showing a caring side towards Mishti. Writers would continue to have the duo stuck contemplating a relationship but ultimately remain friends. Producers finally decided to unite the pair in September 2017. When Amy wants Leo to sell his share of the Robinsons hotel she concocts a plan to get him and Mishti together. She assumes that Mishti will be able to convince Leo to sell. Mishti is unaware of Amy's true intentions and thinks she is matchmaking. Leo is furious when he finds out Amy's deceit and presumes Mishti is part of the scam. But Mishti later convinces him of her innocence and they decide to begin a relationship.{{cite web|last1=Kilkelly|first1=Daniel|title=Neighbours passion ahead for Leo Tanaka and Mishti Sharma as they finally get together|url=http://www.digitalspy.com/soaps/neighbours/news/a838330/neighbours-spoilers-leo-tanaka-mishti-sharma-passion/|website=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=([[Hearst Magazines UK]])|accessdate=28 March 2018|date=18 September 2017}} Their romance faces early issues when Leo kisses [[Courtney Grixti]] (Emma Lane) and Mishti witnesses the moment. Courtney is engaged to Leo's father, [[Paul Robinson (Neighbours)|Paul Robinson]] ([[Stefan Dennis]]) and he wants to see if she will be unfaithful. Mishti later forgives Leo when he explains he wanted to ensure Courtney was committed to his father and not after money.{{cite journal|title=Is she faking it?|journal=[[TV Soap]]|date=16-30 October 2017|pages=18–19|publisher=(nextmedia Pty Limited)}} More problems followed focusing on the issue of trust. Mishti becomes secretive over her rogue investigation into the death of [[Hamish Roche]] (Sean Taylor). She lies about her whereabouts. But Mishti installed a tracking app on his telephone device, as a kind gesture to follow each other. Leo uses the app to track down Mishti and discovers she is lying. This caused Leo to believe he can no longer trust Mishti and they nearly break-up.{{cite journal|title=Mishti rumbled!|journal=[[Inside Soap]]|date=11-17 November 2017|issue=45|pages=28|publisher=([[Hearst Magazines UK]])}} Another issue arises when Leo's friend [[Elly Conway]] ([[Jodi Anasta]]) gets drunks and kisses Leo. The moment is witnessed by Dipi who informs Mishti, leading her to believe they were seeing each other.{{cite web|last1=Morris|first1=Sasha|title=Neighbours spoilers: Ramsay Street rocked by another cheating scandal|url=https://www.dailystar.co.uk/showbiz-tv/hot-tv/649211/Neighbours-spoilers-Jodi-Anasta-Elly-Conway-cheat-Tim-Kano-Leo-Tanaka|website=[[Daily Star (United Kingdom)|Daily Star]]|publisher=([[Northern & Shell]])|accessdate=28 March 2018|date=2 October 2017}} Mishti is forced to re-assume her role as peacemaker when Dipi and Leo begin arguing. Dipi believes that Leo has ill-advised her husband Shane over a business deal. She accusess him of plotting to secure a free urine powered generator Shane has invented. This is not true and Mishti is left with the task of solving their rift.{{cite web|last1=Morris|first1=Sasha|title=Neighbours bombshell Mishti flaunts endless legs in tiniest outfit yet|url=https://www.dailystar.co.uk/showbiz-tv/hot-tv/677238/Neighbours-spoilers-Scarlet-Vas-Mishti-Sharma-legs-outfit-Dipi-Rebecchi-Sharon-Johal|website=[[Daily Star (United Kingdom)|Daily Star]]|publisher=([[Northern & Shell]])|accessdate=28 March 2018|date=26 January 2018}} They continue to bicker and fall into a swimming pool at a family barbecue.{{cite journal|title=Dipi takes a dip!|journal=[[Inside Soap]]|date=20-26 January 2018|issue=3|pages=29|publisher=([[Hearst Magazines UK]])}} In March 2018, ''Neighbours'' confirmed a new pregnancy story featuring Mishti and Leo.{{cite web|last1=Kilkelly|first1=Daniel|title=Neighbours confirms new pregnancy storyline as Elly Conway makes a huge discovery|url=http://www.digitalspy.com/soaps/neighbours/news/a851461/neighbours-spoilers-pregnancy-storyline/|website=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=([[Hearst Magazines UK]])|accessdate=28 March 2018|date=5 March 2018}} Leo is hurt at the Robinson Heights development site. A slab of broken concrete falls on top of him and leaves him trapped. Mishti is called out to the incident and is shocked to find Leo. Vas told Ellis (''Inside Soap'') that Mishti is worried and can only reassure her boyfriend. But he is taken to hospital and recovers. The events lead Mishti to reveal her pregnancy. Vas explained that Mishti and Leo's relationship is still new, so she is unsure of how he will react. They had not thought about having children so are unsure about keeping it. But their families discover their news and are excited. The actress added "she and Leo aren't even sure they want to have the baby yet - but they're forced to go along with the family's celebrations."{{cite journal|first=Sarah|last=Ellis|title=Knocked up & knocked down!|journal=[[Inside Soap]]|date=10-16 March 2018|issue=10|pages=25|publisher=([[Hearst Magazines UK]])}} But Vas told Sally Brockway from ''Soaplife'' that Dipi's advice and support actually helps Mishti accept her pregnancy. Dipi's encouragement about being a mother makes Mishti "feel like she can do it because Dipi is an amazing mum to her three children." Mishti's next problem is telling Leo's father Paul as she fears his disapproval. To her surprise he is supportive. Vas added that Mishti thinks everything will be okay once Paul accepts the news. But she warned of many "twists and turns" for her relationship with Leo.{{cite journal|last1=Brockway|first1=Sally|title=Mishti's baby bombshell!|journal=[[Soaplife]]|date=10-16 March 2018|issue=430|pages=52|publisher=([[Time Inc. UK]])}} It was later announced that Mishti would lose her unborn child in a miscarriage story.{{cite web|last1=Kilkelly|first1=Daniel|title=Neighbours lines up tragedy for Mishti Sharma as she suffers a miscarriage|url=http://www.digitalspy.com/soaps/neighbours/news/a853157/neighbours-spoilers-mishti-sharma-miscarriage/|website=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=([[Hearst Magazines UK]])|accessdate=28 March 2018|date=26 March 2018}} Mishti and Leo argue about his new role at Lassiters hotel and she experiences pains. When she is taken to hospital she is told that she has suffered a miscarriage. A reporter from ''Soaplife'' revealed that Mishti's loss would "utterly devastated" but ultimately bring Mishti and Leo closer together. Their resilience is short-lived when Mishti's friend [[Monique Hughes]] (Madeleine Vizard) visits and ruins their relationship. She was a colleague at the police academy Mishti and Zander attended. Monique discovers that Lassiter's has sold alcohol to a minor and blackmails him for money in exchange for her silence.{{cite journal |last1=Downe |first1=Stephen |title=Friend or foe? |journal=[[TV Week]] |date=14-20 April 2018 |issue=15 |pages=11 |publisher=([[Bauer Media Group]])}} ===Dilhan Ozdil feud=== Writers planned a [[revenge porn]] story for Mishti which began in June 2018. Rory O'Connor from the ''[[Daily Express]]'' reported that the story would leave a "trail of devastation" for the character.{{cite web |last1=O'Connor |first1=Rory |title=Neighbours spoilers: NAKED pictures stolen leaving one character in utter turmoil |url=https://www.express.co.uk/showbiz/tv-radio/965587/Neighbours-spoilers-Mishti-Sharma-Scarlet-Vas-Naked-Plot-Channel-5-Soap |website=[[Daily Express]] |publisher=([[Northern & Shell]]) |accessdate=13 July 2018 |date=26 May 2018}} When Mishti attends a night out drinking with her friends she decides to have casual sex with [[Dilhan Ozdil]] (Kyle Hazebroek). She takes Dilhan back to her home and is unaware he intends to rob her. Vas told Maddison Hockey from ''[[TV Week]]'' that Mishti's reasons for her care-free behaviour is due to her need to move on from her miscarriage. She is initially "hesitant" but her friend [[Chloe Brennan (Neighbours)|Chloe Brennan]] ([[April Rose Pengilly]]) convinces her to have fun. Following their encounter Dilhan sneaks out of the bedroom to steal money, but [[Xanthe Canning]] (Lilly Van der Meer) disturbs him. Mishti is shocked and left questioning her bevahiour but decides that she must track Dilhan down to arrest him. Then Mishti receives text messages revealing that he recorded them having sex and will upload it online if she does not drop the charges.{{cite journal |last1=Hockey |first1=Madison |title=Man hunt |journal=[[TV Week]] |date=2-8 June 2018 |issue=22 |pages=10 |publisher=([[Bauer Media Group]])}} Mishti ignores his threats and enlists the help of Aaron to retrieve the footage from Dilhan, which is unsuccessful and it is shared online. Mishti is left humiliated and feels ashamed when a stranger recognises her and makes a lewd remark.{{cite web |last1=Morris |first1=Sasha |title=Neighbours bombshell devastated as X-rated sex tape leaked |url=https://www.dailystar.co.uk/showbiz-tv/hot-tv/708251/Neighbours-spoilers-Scarlet-Vas-Mishti-Sharma-sex-tape-Leo-Tanaka-Tim-Kano |website=[[Daily Star (United Kingdom)|Daily Star]] |publisher=([[Northern & Shell]]) |accessdate=13 July 2018 |date=8 June 2018}} Mishti feels more positive when Dilhan is arrested but his family secure his bail and he is released. Vas told from Hockey that Mishti wants to move on but Dilhan receiving bail hinders that. She explained that Mishti "just feels defeated, she's very angry with the whole situation." Leo becomes concerned and decides to try and trick Dilhan into breaking his bail conditions. He tries to cause a fight but when Dilhan goads him, Leo ends up punching [[Ned Willis]] (Ben Hall) instead.{{cite journal |title=Fist first |journal=[[TV Week]] |date=16-22 June 2018 |issue=24 |pages=12 |publisher=([[Bauer Media Group]])}} Dilhan continues to harass Mishti and sends her a series of threatening text messages. She worries her friends because of her reluctance to report the abuse. He threatens to visit her home and Mishti hears an intruder in her garden. Mishti is alarmed and recklessly withdraws her gun and fires a warning shot out of the door, which jeopardises her police career.{{cite web |last1=Kilkelly |first1=Daniel |title=Neighbours lines up shooting drama for Mishti Sharma after sinister threats |url=http://www.digitalspy.com/soaps/neighbours/news/a859693/neighbours-spoilers-mishti-sharma-shooting-drama/ |website=[[Digital Spy]] |publisher=([[Hearst Magazines UK]]) |accessdate=13 July 2018 |date=18 June 2018}} ===Departure=== On 8 October 2018, Daniel Kilkelly of ''Digital Spy'' confirmed that the character would be departing the serial the following week. Mishti decides to leave Erinsborough to join her fiancé [[Pavan Nahal]] (Akkshey Caplash) in Sydney.{{cite web|url=https://www.digitalspy.com/soaps/neighbours/news/a867850/neighbours-spoilers-mishti-sharma-scarlet-vas-exit/|title=Neighbours exit for Mishti Sharma as she leaves Ramsay Street with Pavan|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|date=8 October 2018|work=[[Digital Spy]]|accessdate=8 October 2018}} Mishti's exit scenes aired on 19 October.{{cite web|url=https://digiguide.tv/programme-details/Channel+5/19+October+2018/12:45/Neighbours/Soap/|title=Neighbours (Soap) Friday, October 19th, 2018|publisher=Digiguide|accessdate=8 October 2018}} The following day, Vas posted a message about her departure on [[Instagram]] saying she "loved portraying every minute" of Mishti. She added, "{{sic|Thankyou}} to all the amazing viewers during my time on @neighbours.. To all my Mishti fans, your love and support means the world to me and I can't wait for you all to come with me on my journey in the next stage of my career...."{{cite web|url=http://www.digitalspy.com/soaps/neighbours/news/a868873/neighbours-scarlet-vas-breaks-silence-mishti-sharma-exit/|title=Neighbours star Scarlet Vas breaks her silence on Mishti Sharma's exit|last=Warner|first=Sam|date=20 October 2018|work=[[Digital Spy]]|accessdate=20 October 2018}} ==Storylines== Mishti comes to Harold's Café in Erinsborough to talk to Shane Rebecchi about whether his brother [[Toadfish Rebecchi]] ([[Ryan Moloney]]) can help them. Mishti then tells Shane that she might have found a way to solve their problem. Shane later tells Mishti that he is thinking of moving to Erinsborough, as he and his wife Dipi need a fresh start. She asks Shane if he has told Toadie everything, but he says he is planning to. Mishti stays at the Erinsborough Backpackers and flirts with Leo. They agree that neither of them want a serious relationship. Mishti surprises Dipi when she and her daughters finally arrive in Erinsborough. Mishti helps an injured [[Piper Willis]] (Mavournee Hazel) when a ute crashes into the backpackers hostel. She continues to stay involved in the investigation and drives Tyler to the city, so he can question [[T-Bone (Neighbours)|T-Bone]] (Des Flanagan). When Tyler assaults T-Bone, Mishti reports him to the police and it emerges that she is a former police officer. Shane admits to Dipi that Mishti gave him a loan, as he lost a lot of money trying to get his solar-powered lawnmower to work. Mishti also reveals that she followed Shane to Erinsborough to help out and get away from her old life. Mishti befriends Aaron and they buy a local gym together. While arguing with Leo, Mishti gets into her car and reverses into Tyler. She briefly goes into shock, while Tyler is left with severe bruising. Mishti reveals to Leo that she was once engaged to a fellow police officer named Zander, who was run down and killed during an [[Random breath test|RBT]] patrol, and the driver responsible escaped justice. Shane later tells Dipi that shortly after Zander's death, he found Mishti smashing up the house and threatening to get justice for Zander. He stopped her from leaving with her service weapon, and she decided to quit the force. Mishti tells Dipi that the accident with Tyler reminded her of Zander. She starts a relationship with Leo. She finds Leo with Courtney and suspects he was cheating on her and runs off. Leo finds her and assures her that he was only trying to find out if Courtney was truly committed to her relationship with his dad, Paul. She is suspicious in the whereabouts of Gary and his mother [[Sheila Canning]] ([[Colette Mann]]) on the night of Hamish's death and investigates. Impressing the sergeant she is then offered to return to a job in the police force and accepts. Mishti tells Aaron that she will no longer be working with him at The Shed. Mishti investigates Paul's interference with hotel records, but is ordered to stop. She arrests Shane following a drunken public disturbance on Ramsay Street and puts him in a cell to sober up. Dipi is angry with Mishti arresting her own family, but she later forgives her sister. While on duty, Mishti receives a radio call indicating that an accident occurred at the Robinson Heights housing development site. Mishti arrives to find Leo being treated by paramedics after being crushed by a concrete slab. After Leo is given the all clear, Mishti tells him she is pregnant. Kirsha hears about Mishti's pregnancy and tells her family. Mishti experiences pains and miscarries her baby. She and Leo agree that it was too soon to start a family and move on. Mishti's former colleague [[Monique Hughes]] (Madeleine Vizard) visits and they reminisce about their time working with Zander. Monique discovers that Lassiters have illegally sold alcohol to Xanthe and she tries to blackmail Leo in exchange for her silence. This causes Leo to hire a private investigator and he discovers that Monique and Zander had been involved with illegal gangs. Leo informs Mishti who is devastated that her boyfriend, best friend and ex-fiancé have all lied to her. She realises she can no longer trust anyone and ends her relationship with Leo. Mishti has a one-night stand with Dilhan Ozdil and he steals money from her purse. Dilhan threatens to upload footage of them having sex to the internet if she does not drop the theft charges. Aaron helps Mishti retrieve the footage and she arrests Dilhan. He is granted bail and makes the footage public. Mishti delivers a talk at Erinsborough High about the emotional impact of revenge porn. She tries to move on, but Dilhan starts sending her abusive text messages. When she is home alone Dilhan's texts make her feel unsafe. Chloe creeps into Mishti's back garden to check-up on her, Mishti withdraws her gun and discharges a warning shot. Mishti is overcome with guilt and reports herself to the police, who decide not to take any legal action and request that she retakes her weapon training. Mishti sells her half of The Shed to Paul. After an unsuccessful date with [[Rob Carson]] (Christopher Farrell), Mishti joins an arranged marriage website, where she meets Sydney dentist Pavan Nahal. After opening up about their pasts, Mishti and Pavan become engaged. Mishti agrees to help [[Mark Brennan (Neighbours)|Mark Brennan]] ([[Scott McGregor (model)|Scott McGregor]]) search for Monique and contacts her. Monique has Dilhan beaten up, before meeting with Mishti. Monique realises she is being set up and Mishti arrests her. At the station, Mishti learns that she is compromised an investigation and is suspended. Pavan calls of the engagement when he learns about the sex tape and Mishti accuses Dipi of telling him about it. Dipi later intervenes and speaks to Pavan. She learns that Monique sent the video, and that he was angry that Mishti did not tell him about it. Pavan comes to see Mishti and they reconcile. When he receives a job offer in Sydney, Mishti decides to leave Erinsborough to be with him. Dipi organises a farewell party for her before she departs. ==Reception== Di Hollingsworth from ''What's on TV'' branded Mishti a "stunningly beautiful and superfit" character. She added "it's been clear from the off she’s hiding something."{{cite web|last1=Hollingsworth|first1=Di|title=Mystery of Mishti Sharma revealed in Neighbours?|url=http://www.whatsontv.co.uk/neighbours/mishti-mystery-revealed-neighbours-471108/|website=[[What's on TV]]|publisher=([[Time Inc. UK]])|accessdate=28 March 2018|date=21 May 2017}} Claire Crick from ''Soaplife'' said "Leo Tanaka and Mishti Sharma are certainly something of a power couple. Not only are they both massively successful in their beloved jobs, but they also make a beautiful pairing to boot."{{cite journal|last1=Crick|first1=Claire|title=Mishti's baby heartbreak!|journal=[[Soaplife]]|date=31 March - 6 April 2018|issue=433|pages=34|publisher=([[Time Inc. UK]])}} Another branded her "mysterious Mishti Sharma".{{cite journal|title=Man down! Tyler hit by Mishti!|journal=[[Soaplife]]|date=12-25 August 2017|issue=413|pages=32|publisher=([[Time Inc. UK]])}} Sasha Morris from the ''[[Daily Star (United Kingdom)|Daily Star]]'' has called the character a "brunette bombshell" and "peacemaker", adding "Mishti cemented her position as Neighbours' latest hottie." Responding to the viewers incorrect theories Mishti is Dipi's secret daughter, Morris said "that would be the mother of all plot twists."{{cite web|last1=Morris|first1=Sasha|title=Neighbours spoilers: Dipi Rebecchi revealed to be secret mum of this character?|url=https://www.dailystar.co.uk/showbiz-tv/hot-tv/689447/Neighbours-spoilers-Scarlet-Vas-Mishti-Sharma-shock-Dipi-Rebecchi-secret-mum|website=[[Daily Star (United Kingdom)|Daily Star]]|publisher=([[Northern & Shell]])|accessdate=28 March 2018|date=16 March 2018}} Helen Daly from the ''[[Daily Express]]'' named her "the new cop on the block", "mysterious new character" and said she was "like every police officer that's come before her" for mistrusting Paul.{{cite web|last1=Daly|first1=Helen|title=Neighbours spoilers: Is Amy going to try and win her brother Leo back?|url=https://www.express.co.uk/showbiz/tv-radio/794803/Neighbours-spoilers-Amy-Williams-try-win-BROTHER-Leo-Tanaka-back-incest-storyline|website=[[Daily Express]]|publisher=([[Northern & Shell]])|accessdate=28 March 2018|date=21 April 2017}}{{cite web|last1=Daly|first1=Helen|title=Neighbours spoilers: Paul Robinson to be arrested after shock Gabe twist?|url=https://www.express.co.uk/showbiz/tv-radio/903386/Neighbours-spoilers-Paul-Robinson-ARRESTED-shock-Gabe-twist-Mishti-Sharma-Paige-Smith|website=[[Daily Express]]|publisher=([[Northern & Shell]])|date=11 January 2018}} Upon learning Mishti's secret past, a ''[[Liverpool Echo]]'' writer stated "they're the stuff on which soaps are so often built, so it should come as no surprise to learn than Mishti has one – and it's a whopper, too."{{cite web|title=Adam Puts the Boot In|url=https://www.highbeam.com/doc/1G1-492129483.html|website=[[Liverpool Echo]]|publisher=([[Trinity Mirror]] via [[Highbeam Research]])|accessdate=28 March 2018|date=20 May 2017}}{{subscription required}} ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * [https://tenplay.com.au/channel-eleven/neighbours/characters/mishti-sharma Mishti Sharma] at the Official ''Neighbours'' website {{Neighbours characters|past}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Sharma, Mishti}} [[Category:Neighbours characters]] [[Category:Fictional characters introduced in 2017]] [[Category:Fictional police constables]] [[Category:Fictional personal trainers]] [[Category:Female characters in television]]

revision.text:
{{Infobox dancer |name = Nakul Dev Mahajan |image = |alt = |caption = |image_size = 150 |birth_date = {{birth date and age|1975|9|15}} |birth_place = [[Agra]], [[India]] |height = |occupation = [[Dancer]], [[choreography|choreographer]] |years_active =2003 - present |current_group = NDM Dance Productions and Studios |former_groups = |dances = [[Bollywood dance]] |website = {{URL|http://www.ndmdance.com/ }} }} '''Nakul Dev Mahajan''' (born September 15, 1975) is an [[United States|American]] [[Bollywood dance|Bollywood]] [[dancer]] and [[choreographer]] best known for his choreography on ''[[So You Think You Can Dance (U.S. TV series)|So You Think You Can Dance]]''. He is the [[Entrepreneur|founder]] and [[artistic director]] of NDM Dance Productions and Studios, a Bollywood dance company based in [[Artesia, California|Artesia, CA]]. ==Early life and background== Born in [[Agra]], India, in a [[Punjabi people|Punjabi]] family,{{cite web| title = Dance Like a Man - Indian Express | url = http://www.indianexpress.com/news/dance-like-a-man/1195860/0 |author=Jaskiran Kapoor|date=Nov 17, 2013|accessdate = 2013-12-12 }} Mahajan and his family immigrated to the United States in the 1960s.{{cite news |last=Nataraj |first=Nirmala |date= 12 Jan 2009 |title= One Man, One Vision|url= https://www.indiacurrents.com/articles/2009/01/12/one-man-one-vision|newspaper= [[India Currents]]|location= |access-date=25 Feb 2016 }} Mahajan began formal dance training at age 17, and graduated from the [[University of California, Riverside]] with a [[bachelor's degree]] in Sociology and Dance in 2002.{{cite web | title = Notable Alumni - Nakul Dev Mahajan |publisher= UC Riverside Alumni Association| archive-url =https://web.archive.org/web/20160125162457/http://www.alumni.ucr.edu/page.aspx?pid=1018 |archive-date =25 Jan 2016 |url=http://www.alumni.ucr.edu/page.aspx?pid=1018| accessdate = 2013-12-12}} ==Career== [[File:Michelle Obama joins students for a Bollywood Dance Clinic in White House.jpg|thumb|350px|Michelle Obama joins students for a Bollywood Dance Clinic with Nakul Dev Mahajan, in White House, November 5, 2013]] The work of Nakul Dev Mahajan has been influenced by [[classical indian dance]]s and Western dance styles ([[Hip-hop dance|hip-hop]], [[Latin dance|Latin]] and [[Jazz dance|jazz]]).{{cite news |last=Abramowitz |first=Rachel |date= |title= Cutting a red carpet: Indian dance teacher Nakul Dev Mahajan teaches some moves before the show| url=http://articles.latimes.com/2009/feb/23/entertainment/et-oscarindia23 |newspaper=[[Los Angeles Times]] |location= |access-date= 19 Jun 2010}} As a result of his efforts to teach and promote the Bollywood dance style, Mahajan has been called ''[[Hollywood|Hollywood’s]] Favorite Bollywood Choreographer''{{cite web |url=http://www.buzzine.com/2009/02/one-man-bollywood-show/ |archive-url= https://web.archive.org/web/20090418181207/http://www.buzzine.com/2009/02/one-man-bollywood-show|archive-date=18 Apr 2009 |title= One-man Bollywood Show: Hollywood's Favorite Bollywood Choreographer|last1=Parimal |first1=Rohit M. |date= |website=[[Blossom Elfman#Buzzine|Buzzine]] |publisher= |access-date= 4 Jun 2010}} and an ''Ambassador of Bollywood Dance''. Mahajan appeared as a guest star (dancer) in [[Diwali (The Office)|season 3, episode 6 (''Diwali'')]] of ''[[The Office (U.S. TV series)|The Office]]'' (TV [[sitcom]]),{{cite web |url=http://www.tv.com/shows/the-office/diwali-897498/cast/ |title=The Office Diwali Season 3 Episode 6 Cast and Crew |author= |date= 2 Nov 2006 |website=TV.com |publisher=CBS Interactive Inc. |access-date= 18 Feb 2016}} led a Bollywood Dance instructional session prior to the [[81st Academy Awards]] (2009),{{cite news |last=Abramowitz |first=Rachel |date=2009 |title=Cutting a red carpet: Indian dance teacher Nakul Dev Mahajan teaches some moves before the show |url=http://articles.latimes.com/2009/feb/23/entertainment/et-oscarindia23 |newspaper=[[Los Angeles Times]] |location= |access-date= 25 Feb 2016}} and choreographed a flash mob style Bollywood scene for an episode of [[Fuller House (TV series)]] (2016).{{cite news |author=|date= 1 Mar 2016 |title=Nakul Dev Mahajan Choreographs Bollywood Piece on ‘Fuller House’ |url=http://www.indiawest.com/entertainment/global/nakul-dev-mahajan-choreographs-bollywood-piece-on-fuller-house/article_7dc39516-dfec-11e5-a0ad-a30d75304cac.html |newspaper= India-West |access-date= 5 Mar 2016}}{{cite web |url=http://mashable.com/2016/03/01/fake-bollywood-on-tv/#gMBOV57AMmq9 |title= Ranking Bollywood numbers on American TV, from fine to godawful|last1=Khosla |first1= Proma |date=2016 |website=[[Mashable]] |publisher= Mashable|access-date= 5 Mar 2016}} [[Sonia Singh (author)]] and Mahajan co-authored the script for ''One Man Bollywood Show'', a 2009 stage production performed by Mahajan. In 2011, Mahajan was the recipient of the [[University of California, Riverside]] ''Outstanding Young Alumnus Award''.{{cite web |url=http://chancellorsdinner.ucr.edu/dinner11/ |title=2011 Chancellor’s Dinner Benefits Merit Scholarships, Recognizes Excellence |author= |date= 2011|website= [[University of California, Riverside]] |publisher= Regents of the University of California|access-date= 25 Feb 2016}}{{cite AV media |people=Nakul Dev Mahajan, Cydney Watson |date=31 Oct 2011 |title= Arts/Culture: UCR Outstanding Young Alumnus Nakul Dev Mahajan (’02) |url=http://ucrtoday.ucr.edu/563 |access-date= 25 Feb 2016|archive-url= |archive-date= |format= |time= |location= |publisher=Regents of the University of California |id= |isbn= |oclc= |quote= |ref= }} ===Dance Studios=== In 2003, Mahajan founded ''NDM Bollywood Dance Productions and Studios'', the first Bollywood [[dance school]] in the U.S.; the school has since served over 3000 students.{{cite web|url=http://bravuraartist.com/2008/07/17/desis-sure-can-dance/#comments |title=Desis Sure Can Dance |last1=Tirusha |first1= |date=17 July 2008 |website=Bravura Artist |publisher= |access-date=23 Jun 2010 |quote= |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090214083145/http://bravuraartist.com/2008/07/17/desis-sure-can-dance/ |archivedate=February 14, 2009 }} In 2015, 430 students and 20 members of the school's dance troupe performed ''Bollywood Travels'' (the annual student recital) for a total of 2700 audience members.{{cite news |last=Rohit |first=Parimal M. |date=3 Apr 2015 |title=Nakul Dev Mahajan Dance Troupe Travels the World, Bollywood Style |url=http://www.indiawest.com/entertainment/global/nakul-dev-mahajan-dance-troupe-travels-the-world-bollywood-style/article_a381bcf4-d98c-11e4-9997-8fb912c9ba19.html |newspaper= India-West|location=Redondo Beach, CA, USA |access-date=8 Feb 2016 }} Mahajan serves as a guest instructor in the faculty of the [[Broadway Dance Center]].{{cite web |url=https://www.broadwaydancecenter.com/faculty/bios/mahajan_nakul.shtml |title=Nakul Dev Mahajan, BDC Guest Instructor |author= |date= 2016|website= [[Broadway Dance Center]]|publisher=Broadway Dance Center |access-date= 25 Feb 2016}} ===''So You Think You Can Dance'' (U.S., 2008-2015)=== Nakul Dev Mahajan's choreography introduced the Bollywood Dance style to the stage of ''[[So You Think You Can Dance]]'' (reality TV show) in Season 4. [[Katee Shean]] and [[Joshua Allen]]'s performance of Mahajan's routine for [[So You Think You Can Dance (season 4)|Season 4]] was in [[YouTube]]'s "Most Viewed" list for one week,{{cite web|url=http://www.dancespirit.com/articles/2466 |title=Nakul Dev Mahajan: The Mastermind Behind Bollywood |last1=Jones |first1=Jen |date= |website= |publisher=Dance Spirit Magazine |access-date=4 Jun 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100501123025/http://www.dancespirit.com/articles/2466 |archivedate=May 1, 2010 }} and was included in [[BuzzFeed]]'s 2014 ''25 Best 'So You Think You Can Dance' Routines of all Time'' listing.{{cite web |url=https://www.buzzfeed.com/ariellecalderon/the-best-so-you-think-you-can-dance-routines#.sd8W103jK |title= The 25 Best "So You Think You Can Dance" Routines Of All Time|last1=Calderon |first1=Arielle|last2=Chen |first2= Tanya |date=27 Aug 2014 |website= [[BuzzFeed]]|publisher=BuzzFeed, Inc.|access-date= 24 Feb 2016|quote=}} In subsequent seasons of the show, Bollywood performances were included regularly (see summary table, below). ====Choreography for ''So You Think You Can Dance (U.S.)''==== {|class="wikitable" width="90%" |- !Season !Week !Dancers !Style !Song !Result !Reference |- |rowspan="3"|[[So You Think You Can Dance (U.S. season 4)|4]] |5 |[[List of So You Think You Can Dance finalists (U.S. season 4)#Katee Shean|Katee Shean]]

Alex Wong |[[Bollywood]] |''Naacho Re'' from ''[[Jai Ho (film)]]'' soundtrack |Safe | |- |- |} ===''So You Think You Can Dance'' (Canada, 2008)=== Mahajan choreographed the ''group dance'' performance of ''Nagada, Nagada'' from [[Jab We Met]] in [[So You Think You Can Dance Canada (season 1)]]. === ''Superstars of Dance'' === Mahajan coached team [[India]] at the [[Superstars of Dance]] on the [[NBC Network]] and choreographed six remaining crews at the 2009 [[America's Best Dance Crew (season 4)|ABDCrews (season 4)]].{{cite web |url=http://www.buzzine.com/2009/02/team-indias-dancing-queens/ |title= TEAM INDIA’S DANCING QUEENS - Team India Members Shine on 'Superstars of Dance'|last=Rohit |first=Parimal M. |date=|website= |series= |publisher= |location= |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090804134901/http://www.buzzine.com/2009/02/team-indias-dancing-queens/ |archive-date= 4 Aug 2009|access-date=22 Jun 2010}}Bracchitta, John. [http://www.realitytvworld.com/news/nbc-reveals-identities-of-superstars-of-dance-teams-and-judges-8218.php "NBC reveals the identities of 'Superstars of Dance's teams and judges"], ''www.realitytvworld.com'', Retrieved on 22 Jun 2010.{{cite web |url= http://www.mtv.com/news/2377297/can-the-abdcrews-learn-bollywood-in-a-week/|title= Can The ABDCrews Learn Bollywood In A Week? |author= |date= 26 Aug 2009|website= [[MTV news]]|publisher=Viacom International Inc. |access-date=24 Jun 2010}} === Cancer === ====Diagnosis==== A 2012 diagnosis of Stage 2 [[testicular cancer]] and subsequent [[chemotherapy]] treatment interrupted Mahajan's career.{{cite news |last=Randeria-Leonard |first= Shyamal|title=Ambassador of Bollywood Dance |date= 16 Dec 2014 |url= https://www.indiacurrents.com/articles/2014/12/16/ambassador-bollywood-dance|newspaper=India Currents - The Complete Indian American Magazine |location= |access-date= 8 Feb 2016}} ====Check Yourself==== In 2014, Mahajan choreographed a section of [[Paula Abdul]]'s performance in ''Check Yourself'', a [[breast cancer]] PSA ([[public service announcement]]) production by [[Avon Products]].{{cite news |author=|date= 23 Oct 2014|title=Nakul Dev Mahajan Choreographs for Paula Abdul |url=http://www.indiawest.com/entertainment/global/nakul-dev-mahajan-choreographs-for-paula-abdul/article_c8aeecb6-5b08-11e4-bdaf-e7433ebf453e.html |newspaper=India West |location= |access-date= 18 Feb 2016}}{{cite AV media |people= |date=30 September 2014 |title=Avon #CheckYourself Credits |medium=Digital Video |language= English |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1-hIgx9SO0o |access-date=18 Feb 2016 |publisher= [[Avon Products]]}} Abdul, Mahajan, [[Chucky Klapow]], and Renee Ritchie received a 2015 ''World Choreography Award'' for this work, in the category ''Digital Format''.{{cite web |url= http://worldchoreographyawards.com/|title=World Choreography Awards|author= |date=16 Nov 2015 |website= World Choreography Awards|publisher= World Choreography Awards|access-date= 18 Feb 2016}}{{cite web |url=http://itsnotaboutme.tv/news/danceaward-show-world-choreography-awards/ |title=WORLD CHOREOGRAPHY AWARDS 2015 |last1=Salkin |first1=Karen |date=24 Nov 2015 |website=It's not about me.tv |publisher= |access-date=18 Feb 2016 |quote=}} === White House Diwali Celebration === Following a tradition started by [[George W. Bush]] in 2003, an annual [[Diwali]] celebration takes place at the [[White House]].{{cite news |last=Anand |first=Kanul|title= This is how the white house celebrates Diwali|url= http://www.indiatimes.com/news/world/this-is-how-the-white-house-celebrates-diwali-228103.html|newspaper= [[India Times]]|location= Washington, DC, USA|date=22 Oct 2014 |access-date= 7 Feb 2016}} For the 2013 edition of the White House Diwali celebration, First Lady [[Michelle Obama]] hosted a Bollywood dance workshop that was instructed and choreographed by Mahajan.{{cite news |last=Yount |first=Stacey |date=10 Nov 2013 |title= WHEN NAKUL DEV MAHAJAN AND BOLLYWOOD WENT TO THE WHITE HOUSE FOR DIWALI!|url=http://bollyspice.com/diwali-nakul-dev-mahajan-bollywood-white-house-exclusive/ |newspaper= Bollyspice.com|location=Washington, DC, USA |access-date= 7 Feb 2016}}{{cite web |url= https://www.whitehouse.gov/the-press-office/2013/11/05/remarks-first-lady-diwali-celebration|title= Remarks by the First Lady at Diwali Celebration|author= |date= 5 Nov 2013|website=[[WhiteHouse.gov]] |publisher= United States Government|access-date= 8 Feb 2016|quote=}} A photo of Michelle Obama dancing a Bollywood routine alongside Mahajan was cited as one of the top White House photos of 2013.{{cite news |author= |title=Michelle Obama's Bollywood dance among top White House photos |url= http://www.ndtv.com/offbeat/michelle-obamas-bollywood-dance-among-top-white-house-photos-547187|newspaper=[[NDTV]] (New Delhi Television Limited) |location= Washington, DC, USA|date=8 Jan 2014 |access-date=7 Feb 2016 }}{{cite news |author= |title=Michelle's Bollywood Dance Moves a Hit! |url=http://www.thehindu.com/todays-paper/tp-in-school/michelles-bollywood-dance-moves-a-hit/article5550361.ece |newspaper=[[The Hindu]] |location=Washington, DC, USA |date=8 Jan 2014 |access-date=7 Feb 2016 }} === Miss America 2014 Pageant === Mahajan choreographed the [[Bollywood]]-[[Indian classical dance]] fusion routine performed by [[Nina Davuluri]] (2014 [[Miss America]] and the first ''Miss America'' of Indian descent) at the [[Miss America 2014]] Talent competition;{{cite news |last= |first= |date=27 Sep 2013 |title=The Bollywood Dance Routine That Stole The Show |url=http://www.indiaabroad-digital.com/indiaabroad/20130927?pg=11#pg11 |newspaper=[[India Abroad]] |location= |access-date=13 Feb 2016 }} the routine was set to the song ''Dhoom Taana'', from the film ''[[Om Shanti Om]]''.{{cite news |last=Tsering |first=Lisa |date=16 Sep 2013 |title=Mahajan Choreographs Another Winning Performance |url=http://www.indiawest.com/news/global_indian/mahajan-choreographs-another-winning-performance/article_cc8b8054-c334-5913-be8a-fa48aabc84af.html |dead-url= |newspaper=India-West |location= |archive-url= |archive-date= |access-date= 6 Feb 2016}} Davuluri's performance of this routine marked the first time a Bollywood dance routine had been performed on the [[Miss America]] stage. Mahajan was named to [[The American Bazaar]]'s ''Top 10 Indian American Entertainers of 2013''.{{cite web |url=http://www.americanbazaaronline.com/2013/12/29/top-10-indian-american-entertainers-2013/ |title= Top 10 Indian American entertainers of 2013|last1= |first1= |last2= |first2= |date=29 Dec 2013 |website=www.americanbazaaronline.com |publisher=The American Bazaar |access-date= 10 Feb 2016|quote=}} === Dance India Dance === Mahajan was selected as a judge for the 2015 edition of [[Dance India Dance]] North America (filmed in [[Mumbai]]).{{cite news |author= |date= 6 July 2015|title=‘Hollywood’s Favorite Bollywood Choreographer’ Nakul Dev Mahajan to judge DID North America 2015 |url= http://zeenews.india.com/entertainment/idiotbox/hollywood%E2%80%99s-favorite-bollywood-choreographer%E2%80%99-nakul-dev-mahajan-to-judge-did-north-america-2015_1625457.html|newspaper= [[Zee TV]]|location= Mumbai, India|access-date=10 Feb 2016 }}{{cite news |last=Warich |first=Sonia |date=17 Sep 2015 |title= Pennsylvania Indian American Teen Wins ‘Dance India Dance’|url=http://www.indiawest.com/news/global_indian/pennsylvania-indian-american-teen-wins-dance-india-dance/article_ed48ea80-5ca7-11e5-8302-5fa5f5e9f0c2.html |newspaper=India West |location=San Leandro, CA, USA |access-date=25 Feb 2016 }} === ''Dance Moms'' === For the Season 6, Episode 5 edition of the [[Reality television|reality TV]] show [[Dance Moms]], Mahajan coached the Abby Lee Dance Company Team, when [[Abby Lee Miller]] unexpectedly failed to attend practice sessions and competition.{{cite web |url=http://www.designntrend.com/articles/69551/20160203/dance-moms-season-6-abby-lee-miller-is-mia-aldc-wins-big-at-fierce-dance-competition.htm |title='Dance Moms' Season 6: Abby Lee Miller Is MIA; ALDC Wins Big At Fierce Dance Competition |last1=Heimbrod |first1=mimi |date=3 Feb 2016 |website= Design & Trend|publisher= IBT Media|access-date=11 Feb 2016}} ==Awards== * 2011 [[University of California, Riverside]] ''Outstanding Young Alumnus Award'' * 2015 India Empire Awards: ''Excellence in Performing Arts''{{cite news |author=|date=2015 |title= INDIA EMPIRE AWARDS BEVERLY HILLS, LOS ANGELES|url=http://indiaempire.com/photostory/858/india_empire_awards_beverly_hills_los_angeles/27 |newspaper= India Empire Magazine|location= |access-date= 25 Feb 2016}} * 2015 World Choreography Award (Category: Digital Format), with [[Paula Abdul]], [[Chucky Klapow]], Renee Ritchee ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.ndmdance.com NDM Dance Studio] *{{IMDb name|3007036}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Dev Mahajan, Nakul}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:1975 births]] [[Category:Indian dance teachers]] [[Category:American choreographers]] [[Category:So You Think You Can Dance choreographers]] [[Category:Participants in American reality television series]] [[Category:University of California, Riverside alumni]] [[Category:American people of Punjabi descent]] [[Category:Indian choreographers]] [[Category:People from Agra]] [[Category:American male artists of Indian descent]] [[Category:American male artists]] [[Category:American artists]] [[Category:Dancers from Uttar Pradesh]]
