{{no footnotes|date=August 2018}} [[File:Nina Veiga Boneca Waldorf (21).JPG|right|thumb|200px|Waldorf dolls]] A '''Waldorf doll''' (also called '''Steiner doll''') is a form of doll compatible with [[Waldorf education|Waldorf (or Steiner) education]] philosophies. Dolls are generally made of natural fibers—such as wool, cotton, or linen—from their stuffing to their hair to their clothing. The doll makers use techniques drawing on traditional European doll-making. The dolls appearance is intentionally simple in order to allow the child playing with it to develop the imagination and creative play. For instance, it has either no features, or a simple neutral expression. The legs and arms are soft and if flexible allow natural postures. They are ideally entirely natural. Dolls vary in the form best suited to the stage of development of the child; from a simple sack or pillow doll for a baby, a knotted or handkerchief style for a teething child, a simple doll with bulky limbs and either short hair or a hat for a toddler. For an older more independent child who can change clothing and dress hair, 'formed' limbed dolls with the ability to sit are introduced with changeable clothing and often longer hair, Typically hair on a Waldorf doll is made of pure wool such as mohair or boucle, ply wool or cotton. facial feature details on a Waldorf doll vary with the maker, generally simple stitches, sometimes painted but features are always a simple suggestion and ideally neutral, so the child can imagine the personality and mood of the doll and if the doll is awake or asleep. Some Waldorf dolls have small suggestions of noses. Skin, eye and mouth colors vary with each doll, ideally to reflect the colouring of the child for a first doll. == See also == * [[Froebel Gifts]] ==References== * ''Kinder Dolls: A Waldorf Doll-Making Handbook'', Maricristin Sealey, Hawthorn Press, 2001, {{ISBN|1-903458-03-X}} ==External links== *{{Commonscat-inline|Waldorf dolls}} [[Category:Dolls]] [[Category:Alternative education]] [[Category:Educational toys]] [[Category:Stuffed toys]]
{{Doll-stub}}

{{Use dmy dates|date=September 2018}} {{Infobox soap character | series = Home and Away | name = Willow Harris | image = [[File:Willow Harris.jpg|200px]] | portrayer = [[Sarah Roberts (actress)|Sarah Roberts]] | introducer = Lucy Addario | first = {{Start date|2017|11|14|df=y}} | years = 2017– | classification = [[List of current Home and Away characters#Present characters|Present; regular]] | occupation = Personal trainer | home = [[Summer Bay#Beach House|Beach House]] | father = [[List of Home and Away characters (2017)#Russell Harris|Russell Harris]] | grandmothers = [[List of Home and Away characters (2017)#Judy Lawson|Judy Lawson]] }} '''Willow Harris''' (also '''Ranger''') is a fictional character from the Australian television soap opera ''[[Home and Away]]'', played by [[Sarah Roberts (actress)|Sarah Roberts]]. The character made her first screen appearance on 14 November 2017. Roberts had auditioned for the roles of both [[Kat Chapman]] and [[Scarlett Snow]] prior to playing Willow. She auditioned successfully and attended screen testing with [[James Stewart (Australian actor)|James Stewart]] who play's Willow's love interest [[Justin Morgan (Home and Away)|Justin Morgan]]. Willow was originally going to be named Amber. She is characterised as a tough female who was raised in a broken home and has subsequently learned to look after herself. Roberts has said that she admires the character's strong personality. Willow is introduced into the show wearing leather, chains and riding a motorbike. This added to her image as a powerful female character.
Writers quickly paired her with Justin and their relationship is marred by a feud with gang member [[Boyd Easton]] ([[Steve Le Marquand]]). His family kidnap Justin's daughter [[Ava Gilbert]] (Grace Thomas), which ends the relationship. Producers introduced Willow's ex-boyfriend [[Dean Thompson]] (Patrick O'Connor) and they resume their relationship. A gambling addiction story was written for Willow and she ends up stealing, loaning money, scamming people and squatting. Roberts found the gambling story challenging and carried out extensive research to accurately portray the issue. The character has been well received by critics of the genre who analysed her strong personality and dramatic introduction into the series.
==Casting== Prior to securing the role of Willow, actress [[Sarah Roberts (actress)|Sarah Roberts]] auditioned for both [[Kat Chapman]] and [[Scarlett Snow]].<ref name="SRoberts">{{cite web|url=https://au.tv.yahoo.com/plus7/home-and-away/-/watch/37845262/home-and-away-extras-sarah-roberts-could-have-been-kat-and-scarlett/|title=Sarah Roberts could've been Kat and Scarlett!|publisher=[[Yahoo7]]|accessdate=15 November 2017|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171115083135/https://au.tv.yahoo.com/plus7/home-and-away/-/watch/37845262/home-and-away-extras-sarah-roberts-could-have-been-kat-and-scarlett/|archivedate=15 November 2017}}</ref> Roberts recorded her first audition for the part while residing in [[Los Angeles]].<ref name=bio/> She flew up from Melbourne to Sydney for the on-set audition and had a chemistry reading with [[James Stewart (Australian actor)|James Stewart]], who plays [[Justin Morgan (Home and Away)|Justin Morgan]]. Roberts did not think she had won the part, as it took a while for the producers to contact her.<ref name="SRoberts"/> The character was originally supposed to be named Amber but this was later changed to Willow.<ref name=bio/> Roberts remembered her first day playing Willow as "awesome", recalling dressing in leather, chains and transforming into character.<ref name=bio/> Willow made her first on screen appearance during the episode broadcast on 14 November 2017.<ref name="ShockAttack">{{cite web|url=https://www.newidea.com.au/home-and-away-justins-shock-attack|title=Home And Away: Justin in shock attack|date=November 2017|work=[[New Idea (magazine)|New Idea]]|publisher=([[Pacific Magazines]])|accessdate=15 November 2017}}</ref>
==Development== ===Characterisation=== {{cquote|Filled with energy and fun, the attractive, fit and dynamic Willow Harris is a delight – but cross her and it's like having a firecracker go off in your face. Raised a single child in a broken home to a rough 'n' tumble dad, she learnt to look out for number one early.|4=''An excerpt taken from The official Home and Away website.''<ref name=bio>{{cite web |title=Willow Harris |url=https://homeandaway.7plus.com.au/willow-harris |website=[[7plus]] |accessdate=13 August 2018 |date=1 January 2018}}</ref>}}
Willow is characterised as "a tough, dynamic and powerful" female and is surrounded by mostly male characters. Roberts made sure she was strong on set to "do justice to her character" in the male dominated scenes.<ref name=nowto1/> She was raised by her father, a single parent, which made Willow learn how to look after herself early in life.<ref>{{cite web |title=Willow Harris |url=https://www.tvnz.co.nz/shows/home-and-away/characters/willow-harris |website=[[TVNZ]] |accessdate=13 August 2018}}</ref> Roberts has described Willow as a "strong female character", who is also independent, loyal and fierce. The actress said Willow would bring "mischief and a bit of trouble" to Summer Bay.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://au.tv.yahoo.com/plus7/home-and-away/-/watch/37845338/home-and-away-extras-willow-harris/|title=All there is to know about Willow Harris|publisher=[[Yahoo7]]|accessdate=15 November 2017|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171115143257/https://au.tv.yahoo.com/plus7/home-and-away/-/watch/37845338/home-and-away-extras-willow-harris/|archivedate=15 November 2017}}</ref> Willow's introduction into ''Home and Away'' showcased her characteristion. Roberts said that Willow proves herself to be "a tough cookie – she's a total firecracker", as she rides into Summer Bay on a motorbike.<ref name=insidesoap3/> She immediately makes herself known to Justin and accuses him of stealing $15,000. Roberts said that Willow validates her tough persona in the scenes where she attacks Justin, ties him up and locks him in his garage overnight.<ref name=insidesoap3/> Roberts told Tamara Cullen from ''[[TV Week]]'' that Willow "rode into town with a lot of power, she's definitely going to cause some mischief!"<ref name=nowto1/>
Roberts told a journalist from ''[[New Idea (magazine)|New Idea]]'' that Willow was "definitely a bad girl. But for all the right reasons. She has taken wrong turns and made decisions that some people would consider 'bad', but only to help the people that she loves."<ref name="ShockAttack"/> In another interview the actress described Willow as "very sassy and fun. She's got attitude. I think she's a woman who knows what she wants and won't stop until she gets it, but is also fiercely loyal and will do anything for the people she loves."<ref name=bio/> Roberts liked her character's "really strong" and "feisty" side and believed the character would stop at nothing to get what she wants. Willow had a difficult life and upbringing, as a result she "put a guard up" not allowing others to emotionally connect with her.<ref name=cromarty/> Willow has a "tougher" wardrobe than that of a traditional feminine one. This helped Roberts to get into character, with her explaining that "I put on her costume and totally feel like her."<ref>{{cite web |last1=Brygel |first1=Jackie |title=Home And Away's James Stewart on co-star and girlfriend Sarah Roberts |url=https://www.newidea.com.au/home-and-away-james-stewart-on-co-star-and-girlfriend-sarah-roberts |website=[[New Idea]] |publisher=([[Pacific Magazines]]) |accessdate=2 October 2018 |date=1 October 2018}}</ref>
===Relationship with Justin Morgan=== Willow was introduced into the show as a new love interest for Justin Morgan.<ref name=ok/> Her first story follows her getting into trouble with [[Boyd Easton]] ([[Steve Le Marquand]]) because she owes him money. He attacks Willow's father and pushes him down stairs. He then vandalises Justin's garage to serve as a warning to help Willow return the missing money.<ref name=soaplife1/> Justin tries to reason with Boyd and his biker gang but the meeting turns violent, leaving Justin bruised. He reports the incident to the police which gets Boyd arrested. [[Martin Ashford (Home and Away)|Ash]] ([[George Mason (actor)|George Mason]]) tries warn Justin to stay away from Willow, he fear for her safety and convinces Willow to move into the local caravan park.<ref name=soaplife1/> Claire Crick from ''[[Soaplife]]'' reported that Justin quickly assumes the role of Willow's "knight in shining armour". She added that despite Willow causing trouble for Justin, he cannot stop thinking about her.<ref name=soaplife2>{{cite journal |last1=Crick |first1=Claire |title=Watch out, Justin... she's trouble! |journal=[[Soaplife]] |date=17-23 February 2018 |issue=427 |pages=36-37 |publisher=([[TI Media]])}}</ref> Stewart told Sarah Ellis from ''[[Inside Soap]]'' that "Justin is becoming quite protective of Willow" and his character "is thrilled" when he gets to spend time with her.<ref>{{cite journal |last1=Ellis |first1=Sarah |title=Justin cops a beating! |journal=[[Inside Soap]] |date=10-16 February 2018 |issue=6 |pages=25 |publisher=([[Hearst Magazines UK]])}}</ref> Roberts and Stewart soon began a relationship off screen.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Briggs |first1=Zoe |title=Inside Home and Away's Sarah Roberts and James Stewart's real life romance |url=https://www.ok.co.uk/celebrity-feature/1321172/home-and-away-sarah-roberts-james-stewarts-real-life-romance-willow-justin-morgan |website=[[OK!]] |publisher=([[Trinity Mirror]]) |accessdate=13 August 2018 |date=6 March 2018}}</ref> Roberts believed their own romance made playing an on screen couple easy. She told Fiona Byrne from the ''[[Herald Sun]]'' that "i did not even have to create any chemistry when I was on screen with Jimmy, it was all just there, it was not a job."<ref name=ok>{{cite web |last1=Byrne |first1=Fiona |title=James Stewart and Sarah Roberts: Home and Away stars confirm real life romance |url=http://www.heraldsun.com.au/entertainment/fiona-byrne/onscreen-chemistry-turned-into-reallife-romance-for-home-and-away-stars/news-story/d6c61e6a3f441c2e9dfb9a5299fc11e2 |website=[[Herald Sun]] |publisher=([[News Corp Australia]]) |accessdate=13 August 2018 |date=27 January 2018}}{{subscriptionrequired}}</ref>
On screen their relationship burgeons when Justin helps Willow secure employment in Summer Bay. Willow competes against [[Mason Morgan]] ([[Orpheus Pledger]]) for a job at the gym. The gym's manager [[John Palmer (Home and Away)|John Palmer]] ([[Shane Withington]]) asks Justin to make the decision about hiring staff. They equally impress him and both receive a job. Willow thanks Justin for his help and they soon end up having sex in her caravan. Their romance has a tumultuous start after Justin asks if their sexual encounter means they are in a relationship. Willow states that she wants a casual arrangement and throws him out.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Morris |first1=Sasha |title=Home and Away spoilers: Summer Bay goes X-rated as two characters have steamy romp |url=https://www.dailystar.co.uk/showbiz-tv/hot-tv/683348/Home-and-Away-spoilers-Sarah-Roberts-Willow-Harris-romp-Justin-Morgan-James-Stewart |website=[[Daily Star (United Kingdom)|Daily Star]] |publisher=([[Northern & Shell]]) |accessdate=13 August 2018 |language=en |date=20 February 2018}}</ref> In later episodes the pair resume their romance. Justin's sister [[Tori Morgan]] ([[Penny McNamee]]) soon disapproves of Willow and tells her that Justin is unhappy with a casual relationship. The pair clash and Willow is put off by Justin's over protective family.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Groome |first1=Imogen |title=Home and Away spoilers reveal Kat and Ash find out who Robbo really is |url=https://www.thesun.co.uk/tvandshowbiz/5667777/home-and-away-spoilers-robbo-kat-ash-olivia-hunter/ |website=[[The Sun (United Kingdom)|The Sun]] |publisher=([[News UK]]) |accessdate=13 August 2018 |date=25 February 2018}}</ref> Producers soon introduced Willow's ex-boyfriend and old friend, [[Dean Thompson]] (Patrick O'Connor) into the show. Dean is a member of the show's fictional criminal gang The River Boys, which Willow also has connections with. Initially Justin does not realise that Willow used to be romantically involved with Dean.<ref name=soaplife3>{{cite journal |last1=Crick |first1=Claire |title=Willow's blast from the past! |journal=[[Soaplife]] |date=17-23 March 2018 |issue=431 |pages=37 |publisher=([[TI Media]])}}</ref>
Writers continued to create trouble between the couple. She was unaware Justin has a daughter, [[Ava Gilbert]] (Grace Thomas). When she comes to stay it shocks Willow, but she and Ava get on well. Justin does not let Willow stay over to avoid upsetting Ava.<ref name=soaplife4/> A ''Home and Away'' publicist told ''Soaplife's'' Crick that Justin is later forced to trust Willow and leave Ava in her care. But when Willow allows Ava to cook dinner, Justin is outraged at the sight of his daughter handling knifes and boiling water. He argues with Willow and their relationship is left "fledging".<ref name=soaplife4>{{cite journal |last1=Crick |first1=Claire |title=Happy Families for Justin & Willow! |journal=[[Soaplife]] |date=5-11 May 2018 |issue=438 |pages=37 |publisher=([[TI Media]])}}</ref> The story takes a sinister turn when Ava is kidnapped by [[Hazel Easton]] ([[Genevieve Lemon]]), who is Boyd's mother. They demand ransom money for Ava's safe return. The publicist told Crick that Willow blames herself because she caused their involvement in Boyd's vendetta. Willow cooperates with Boyd, hands over the cash and Ava is returned home safe. But a local police officer, [[Colby Thorne]] (Tim Franklin) shoots and kills Boyd.<ref name=soaplife5>{{cite journal |last1=Crick |first1=Claire |title=Ava hostage drama turns fatal! |journal=[[Soaplife]] |date=19-25 May 2018|issue=440 |pages=36-37 |publisher=([[TI Media]])}}</ref> Ava's mother [[Nina Gilbert (Home and Away)|Nina Gilbert]] ([[Zoe Naylor]]) warns Willow that Justin cannot have access to Ava if he remains involved with her. Willow breaks-up with Justin and gets back with her ex-boyfriend Dean. Justin is confused and starts a fight with Dean.<ref name=soaplife6>{{cite journal |last1=Darling |first1=Michael |title=Justin & Dean's beach brawl |journal=[[Soaplife]] |date=16-22 June 2018|issue=444 |pages=44 |publisher=([[TI Media]])}}</ref> Roberts told a reporter from ''[[Inside Soap]]'' that her character is "devastated" about her break-up with Justin, but does not want him to lose Ava. She gets with Dean to ensure that Justin moves on. Dean pursues a relationship with Willow and Roberts believed Dean talked her character into it. She assessed "I think Willow is better suited to Justin though. She came to Summer Bay to straighten her life out, and Justin was a perfect match for that reason."<ref name=insidesoap1>{{cite journal |title=Willow snogs Dean! |journal=[[Inside Soap]] |date=9-15 June 2018 |issue=23 |pages=29 |publisher=([[Hearst Magazines UK]])}}</ref>
===Gambling addiction=== {{Quote box|width=15%|align=right|bgcolor=#E6E6FA|quote="Justin has past experience with addicts [...] but Willow's going to be a tough nut to crack when she doesn't even want to help herself."<ref name=soaplife8>{{cite journal |last1=Crick |first1=Claire |title=Willow hits rock bottom! |journal=[[Soaplife]] |date=11-17 August 2018|issue=452 |pages=37 |publisher=([[TI Media]])}}</ref>|source=—A ''Home and Away'' publicist on Willow's addiction (2018)}}Writers planned a gambling addiction storyline for the character. Roberts found it challenging to portray because she had not experienced gambling addiction before. She carried out extensive research into the issue and spoke to gambling addicts to gain an insight into their lives. Roberts said that she used the new found knowledge to deliver a better story on screen.<ref name=insidesoap2/> Willow's gambling problems began following her break-up with Justin. When Willow starts a relationship with Dean he loses his job at the garage. Willow struggles to pay both her and Dean's rent at the caravan park. Willow steals money from the till at the gym and her friend [[Jasmine Delaney]] ([[Sam Frost (TV personality)|Sam Frost]]) catches her.<ref name=metro1/> Jasmine takes pity on Willow and gives her a loan. But when [[Alf Stewart]] ([[Ray Meagher]]) asks for more rent, Willow becomes desperate and gambles away her remaining funds.<ref name=metro1/> She then sells gym equipment to pay Jasmine back, which also leads to a confrontation with Jasmine.<ref name=metro1/> Roberts told a reporter from ''TV Week'' that Willow's gambling addiction is out of control. She explained that her character "feels guilty and shameful, and is acting out in weird ways."<ref name=nowto2/> Willow down plays her addiction but Dean refuses to accept her lies. Roberts said that "Dean knows her so well and can usually help her when things go wrong, but this time, it seems she's in too deep."<ref name=nowto2>{{cite web |title=Jasmine faces the brunt of Willow's rage on Home and Away |url=https://www.nowtolove.com.au/celebrity/tv/willow-slaps-jasmine-home-and-away-spoilers-49106 |website=Now To Love |publisher=([[Bauer Media Group]]) |accessdate=13 August 2018 |date=11 June 2018}}</ref>
Jasmine later learns that Willow has been gambling and tells her that she needs help to treat her addiction. Willow does not take kindly to Jasmine's interfering and slaps her across the face.<ref name=metro1>{{cite web |last1=Groome |first1=Imogen |title=Willow descends into gambling addiction – and slaps Jasmine in Home and Away |url=https://metro.co.uk/2018/07/11/home-and-away-spoilers-willow-descends-into-gambling-addiction-and-gets-violent-with-jasmine-7689201/ |website=[[Metro (British newspaper)|Metro]] |publisher=([[DMG Media]]) |accessdate=13 August 2018 |date=11 July 2018}}</ref> Roberts said that Willow "immediately goes on the defensive" around Jasmine. She added that her character instantly regrets slapping Jasmine because she "knows she's gone too far." The actress was nervous about filming the slap scene. A stunt coordinator taught Roberts and Frost how to make a fake slap without contact look authentic.<ref name=nowto2/> Writers continued to make Willow down on her luck when she tells John the truth about her thefts from the gym. He is upset with her and fires her from her job. Willow is once again left without any money to pay her rent.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Kilkelly |first1=Daniel |title=Willow is fired after she comes clean |url=http://www.digitalspy.com/soaps/home-and-away/spoilers/a860686/home-and-away-spoilers-willow-is-fired-after-she-comes-clean/ |website=[[Digital Spy]] |publisher=([[Hearst Magazines UK]]) |accessdate=13 August 2018 |language=en |date=7 July 2018}}</ref> Willow and Dean begin squatting in Colby's apartment and he borrows money from a loan shark but cannot pay it back. They decide to skim credit cards and tamper with the card machine inside the local restaurant Salt. When they exit the building, they knock Alf to the ground and leave him unconscious.<ref>{{cite journal |last1=Crick |first1=Claire |title=Dean & Willow get desperate! |journal=[[Soaplife]] |date=28 July – 3 August 2018|issue=450 |pages=38 |publisher=([[TI Media]])}}</ref> [[Irene Roberts]] ([[Lynne McGranger]]) becomes their first victim of card skimming when money disappears from her account. The actress told Ellis (''Inside Soap'') that Willow does not want to steal from "decent people", but feels that she has no choice. She also defended her character over Alf and Irene's misfortune, revealing Willow "feels terrible" and "never meant to hurt anyone."<ref name=insidesoap2/>
Writers planned a break-up for Willow and Dean following her continuous problems. Dean confides in Justin about Willow's gambling and requests that he look after her. He then breaks-up with her leaving Justin free to help her. A ''Home and Away'' publicist revealed that Dean "reluctantly" ends the relationship and "know's that Justin is the only person she will listen to."<ref name=soaplife7/> Justin struggles to help Willow overcome her addiction. She lashes out at Justin and blames him for her addiction, but Tori tells her that she ruined her own life.<ref name=soaplife8/> Roberts did not believe that Willow and Dean's relationship was good for her character. She branded it a "whirlwind relationship" that created a "worrying future". Despite this she noted that ''Home and Away'' viewers "love" the duo's "history and unyielding friendship".<ref name=insidesoap2>{{cite journal |first=Sarah |last=Ellis |title=Credit crunchers! |journal=[[Inside Soap]] |date=28 July - 3 August 2018 |issue=30 |pages=47 |publisher=([[Hearst Magazines UK]])}}</ref>
==Reception== Willow's tough persona and dramatic entrance into the series have drawn critical analysis. Ali Cromarty from ''New Idea'' said "If you saw Willow roll into Summer Bay last week, you'd be right to feel a little scared. The new Home And Away recruit is all leather and motorbikes while rocking a 'don't mess with me' attitude."<ref name=cromarty>{{cite web |last1=Cromarty |title=Home And Away's Sarah Roberts: 'I hide behind my smile' |url=https://www.newidea.com.au/home-and-aways-sarah-roberts-confesses-to-hiding-behind-her-smile |website=[[New Idea]] |publisher=([[Pacific Magazines]]) |accessdate=13 August 2018 |date=20 November 2017}}</ref> Tamara Cullen from ''TV Week'' branded her the "sexy, leather-clad Willow" and a "tough girl" who "made quite the impression on Justin."<ref name=nowto1>{{cite web |last1=Cullen |first1=Tamara |title=Meet Home And Away’s new bad girl, Sarah Roberts |url=https://www.nowtolove.com.au/celebrity/tv/home-and-away-new-character-sarah-roberts-43009 |website=Now To Love |publisher=([[Bauer Media Group]]) |accessdate=13 August 2018 |date=22 November 2017}}</ref> Another writer from ''TV Week'' branded Willow a "bikie babe".<ref>{{cite web |title=Dean risks everything to protect Willow this week on Home and Away |url=https://www.nowtolove.com.au/celebrity/tv/dean-willow-gambling-addiction-home-and-away-49924 |website=Now To Love |publisher=([[Bauer Media Group]]) |accessdate=8 September 2018 |date=16 July 2018}}</ref> Imogen Groome from ''[[The Sun (United Kingdom)|The Sun]]'' described Willow's debut in the show as "dramatic scenes" and predicted "adrenaline-fuelled story lines" between her and Justin.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Groome |first1=Imogen |title=Hello Summer Bay Home and Away spoilers – Which new characters are appearing in Home and Away in 2018? |url=https://www.thesun.co.uk/tvandshowbiz/5091102/home-and-away-spoilers-2018-new-characters-colby-dean-jasmine/ |website=[[The Sun (United Kingdom)|The Sun]] |publisher=([[News UK]]) |date=22 March 2018|accessdate=8 September 2017}}</ref> A writer for [[TVNZ]] said "Justin and Willow’s chemistry on-screen was obvious from the start."<ref>{{cite web |title=Justin and Willow's real-life romance |url=https://www.tvnz.co.nz/shows/home-and-away/features/justin-willow-real-life-romance |website=[[TVNZ]] |accessdate=13 August 2018}}</ref> Kerry Harvey from [[Stuff.co.nz]] branded her "the feisty Willow" and a reporter from the New Zealand radio station [[The Hits (radio station)|The Hits]], similarly branded her the "feisty biker girl Willow".<ref>{{cite web |last1=Harvey |first1=Kerry |title=Home And Away actor smitten with Kiwi counterpart |url=https://www.stuff.co.nz/entertainment/tv-radio/tv-guide/101661768/home-and-away-actor-smitten-with-kiwi-counterpart |website=[[Stuff.co.nz]] |publisher=([[Fairfax New Zealand]]) |accessdate=13 August 2018 |language=en |date=22 February 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |title=Home and Away's James Stewart reveals he's in a relationship with co-star |url=https://www.thehits.co.nz/spy/home-and-aways-james-stewart-reveals-hes-in-a-relationship-with-co-star/ |website=[[The Hits (radio station)|The Hits]] |accessdate=13 August 2018 |date=10 January 2018}}</ref> Claire Crick from ''Soaplife'' opined that "Willow creates trouble wherever she goes" and "Willow isn't a stranger to danger and drama."<ref name=soaplife1>{{cite journal |last1=Crick |first1=Claire |title=Justin puts his life on the line! |journal=[[Soaplife]] |date=10-16 February 2018 |issue=426 |pages=34-35 |publisher=([[TI Media]])}}</ref><ref>{{cite journal |last1=Crick |first1=Claire |title=Robbo's last stand! |journal=[[Soaplife]] |date=24-30 March 2018 |issue=432 |pages=38 |publisher=([[TI Media]])}}</ref> Regarding Willow and Justin, she later questioned that "surely this is one couple that's doomed from the start?"<ref name=soaplife2/> Following her gambling addiction drama Crick said that "her life's spiraling out of control" and "crumbling around her".<ref name=soaplife7>{{cite journal |last1=Crick |first1=Claire |title=Willow's week of hell! |journal=[[Soaplife]] |date=4-10 August 2018|issue=451 |pages=38 |publisher=([[TI Media]])}}</ref> ''Inside Soap's'' Ellis said "watch out fellas... there's a feisty new chick riding into Summer Bay this week and she plans on taking no prisoners."<ref name=insidesoap3>{{cite journal |last1=Ellis |first1=Sarah |title=Willow is a real firecracker! |journal=[[Inside Soap]] |date=20-26 January 2018 |issue=3 |pages=49 |publisher=([[Hearst Magazines UK]])}}</ref> The editor of ''[[TV Soap]]'' magazine, Vesna Petropoulos branded Willow and Justin the "Summer Bay sweethearts".<ref>{{cite journal |first=Vesna|last=Petropoulos|journal=[[TV Soap]] |title=From the editor |date=19 March - 2 April 2018 |pages=3 |publisher=([[nextmedia]])}}</ref> In the 2018 [[Digital Spy|''Digital Spy'' Reader Awards]], Willow and Justin were nominated for "Best Soap Couple".<ref>{{cite web |last1=Robinson |first1=Abby |title=The Digital Spy Reader Awards 2018: Vote now for your Soap favourites of the year! |url=http://www.digitalspy.com/soaps/feature/a871228/best-soap-2018/ |website=[[Digital Spy]] |publisher=([[Hearst Magazines UK]]) |accessdate=27 November 2018 |date=27 November 2018}}</ref>
